importantArticles.headline: US-listed shares of Chinese companies, like Alibaba (BABA), PDD Holdings (PDD), and JD.com (JD) fall after President Trump threatened an additional 50% tariff on imports from China. Market Domination host Julie Hyman and Trader Talk podcast host Kenny Polcari take a closer look at the stock moves. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

importantArticles.headline: As part of today's Market Minute, Madison Mills outlines the top stories of the trading day. Intel (INTC) stock plunges as US–China trade war tensions intensify. Dell Technologies (DELL) stock extends losses as Morgan Stanley (MS) analysts raise concerns about tariff impacts. Chinese tech stocks, like Alibaba (BABA), PDD Holdings (PDD), and JD.com (JD), tumble as China retaliates against Trump's new tariffs. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

importantArticles.headline: Stocks kept sliding right into the close Friday as the Dow Jones Industrial Average nose-dived by more than 2,200 points and the Nasdaq careened into bear territory in the wake of China's retaliatory tariffs against those from President Donald Trump.  A robust jobs report and calming words from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell failed to settle investors' nerves on the stock market today.  Futures tumbled even before China said it would initiate a 34% tariff on all imported goods from the U.S., including agricultural products.
importantArticles.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Loses 2,200 Points As Markets In Free Fall; Nasdaq Enters Bear Territory (Live Coverage)

importantArticles.headline: Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) reported significant developments this past quarter, propelling its share price by 53%. Key to this upswing was the buyback of 51 million shares worth $600 million, part of a broader buyback initiative since June 2019. Positive earnings results also bolstered investor confidence, with a nearly threefold rise in net income year-over-year. Despite global market instability from new tariffs imposed by the U.S., which led to widespread declines across major...

importantArticles.headline: Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) plans to release Qwen 3, an upgraded version of its flagship AI model, by April. China’s tech leaders have flooded the market with affordable AI services since a domestic AI startup, DeepSeek, showcased a robust model that it said cost just several million dollars to build, Bloomberg reports.
